FuncDef:
The value-added-service edsg modify-synchronous command enables a specified attribute to take effect upon delivery in EDSG service scenarios.
The undo value-added-service edsg modify-synchronous command disables a specified attribute from taking effect upon delivery in EDSG service scenarios.
By default, only EDSG service activation or deactivation is processed.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an attribute name.
The value is a string of 1 to 64 case-insensitive characters. The available options are filter-id, hw-data-filter, traffic-policy, and class.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
During activation or deactivation of EDSG services, if the user group or UCL access policy needs to be modified , you can enable the traffic-policy attribute to take effect upon delivery. To enable such function, run the value-added-service edsg modify-synchronous command.
During activation or deactivation of EDSG services, if the user class needs to be changed, enable the class attribute to take effect upon delivery.
Implementation Procedure
If the value-added-service edsg modify-synchronous command is run more than once, all configurations take effect, but the command configuration takes effect for users that go online after a command instance is run.
Configuration Impact
After this command is run and EDSG services are activated or deactivated, if the filter-id, traffic-policy, hw-data-filter, class attributes are all delivered, all of the attributes take effect.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
